name: Lawfulness of Processing
description: Legal basis for data processing activities - requires one of six conditions: consent, contract, legal obligation, vital interests, public task, or legitimate interests. Special categories and criminal data have additional restrictions.

name: Transparency
description: Clear and open communication about data processing activities to data subjects in concise, intelligible and easily accessible form using clear and plain language. Includes information obligations under Articles 13-14.

name: Accountability
description: Responsibility to demonstrate GDPR compliance through appropriate technical and organisational measures, documentation (records of processing, DPIAs), and evidence. Controllers must be able to prove compliance with all principles.

name: Data Minimisation
description: Limiting data collection to what is adequate, relevant and necessary in relation to the purposes for which data are processed. Fundamental principle requiring purpose limitation and storage limitation.

name: Data Breach Notification
description: Procedures and timelines for reporting data breaches to supervisory authorities (72 hours under Art. 33) and affected data subjects (when high risk exists under Art. 34). Includes documentation requirements.

name: Security of Processing
description: Appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure security appropriate to risk, including pseudonymisation, encryption, confidentiality, integrity, availability, resilience, and regular testing per Article 32.

name: Consent
description: Freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous indication of data subject wishes by statement or clear affirmative action. Must be demonstrable, separately presented, easy to withdraw, and not conditional for service provision.
